thread.title: NHL: Canadiens win ninth in a row, close in on record
thread.title_full: NHL: Canadiens win ninth in a row, close in on record

author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Canadiens win ninth in a row, close in on record
text:
NHL: Canadiens win ninth in a row, close in on record Associated Press Posted: 10/24/2015 09:40:59 PM PDT Updated: 10/24/2015 10:27:05 PM PDT Saturday's HIGHLIGHTS Canadiens 5, Maple Leafs 3: P.K. Subban and Max Pacioretty each had a goal and an assist, and Montreal extended its season-opening winning streak to nine games. The Canadiens are a victory away from tying the NHL record set by Toronto in 1993-94 and matched by Buffalo in 2006-07. Montreal is at Vancouver on Tuesday night. Blue Jackets 4, Avalanche 3: Ryan Murray and Brandon Dubinsky scored goals early in the third period, and Columbus earned its first win in nine games. Its 0-8-0 start was the worst since the New York Rangers lost their first 11 games in 1943-44. Wild 3, Ducks 0: Devan Dubnyk stopped 15 shots for his first shutout this season to lead Minnesota past Anaheim, which has lost six of its first seven and totaled just six goals. Blackhawks 1, Lightning 0: Jonathan Toews scored his first goal of the season 17 seconds into overtime to give Chicago a win in a rematch of last June's Stanley Cup Final. 
Penguins 2, Predators 1: Phil Kessel scored 41 seconds into overtime to give Pittsburgh a win. Blues: St. Louis forward Jaden Schwartz will be out at least 12 weeks because of a fractured left ankle. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
